fixed acidity.description: The amount of fixed acids present in the wine (g/dm^3)

volatile acidity.description: The amount of acetic acid in the wine, which at too high of levels can lead to an unpleasant, vinegar taste (g/dm^3)

citric acid.description: Found in small quantities, citric acid can add freshness and flavor to wines (g/dm^3)

residual sugar.description: The amount of sugar remaining after fermentation stops, it’s rare to find wines with less than 1 gram/liter and wines with greater than 45 grams/liter are considered sweet (g/dm^3)

chlorides.description: The amount of salt in the wine (g/dm^3)

free sulfur dioxide.description: The free form of SO2 exists in equilibrium between molecular SO2 (as a dissolved gas) and bisulfite ion; it prevents microbial growth and the oxidation of wine (mg/dm^3)

total sulfur dioxide.description: Amount of free and bound forms of S02; in low concentrations, SO2 is mostly undetectable in wine, but at free SO2 concentrations over 50 ppm, SO2 becomes evident in the nose and taste of wine (mg/dm^3)

density.description: The density of the wine, which can provide some information about the alcohol content and the amount of residual sugar (g/cm^3)

pH.description: Describes the level of acidity or basicity in the wine on a scale from 0 (very acidic) to 14 (very basic); most wines are between 3-4 on the pH scale

sulphates.description: Wine additive which can contribute to sulfur dioxide gas (S02) levels, wich acts as an antimicrobial and antioxidant (g/dm^3)

alcohol.description: The percent alcohol content of the wine

quality.description: The quality of the wine, rated on a scale from 0 (very poor) to 10 (very excellent)

prompt.role_prompt: You are an expert in wine quality assessment.
prompt.task_prompt: Based on the physicochemical properties of the wine, please predict the quality score.
prompt.answer_prompt: The quality score of the wine is:.

prompt.role_prompt: You are an expert in wine chemistry.
prompt.task_prompt: Based on the physicochemical properties of the wine, please predict the alcohol content.
prompt.answer_prompt: The alcohol content of the wine is:.

prompt.role_prompt: You are an expert in wine chemistry.
prompt.task_prompt: Based on the physicochemical properties of the wine, please predict the pH value.
prompt.answer_prompt: The pH value of the wine is:.
